yBnl6FROItmkWsBqUC-g6g.text: Loved it! I admit that I was drunk at the time I visited the place, but even so, the food was divine! Just what I needed after having drunk about 8 pints on an empty stomach! Portions were large and were good value for money in comparison to other places in the area. The drinks were good as well, with a different twist to them such as pickle based shots! Sounds disgusting I know, but actually were really nice! Will have to go back there sober to ensure that it is as nice as remembered!

cZG486bmOkKcILWlSxCSKg.text: My boyfriend and I love this place! The burnt ends and pulled pork are great. Best American-style BBQ in london. I also like this location better than the one in Soho, where I ate upstairs and the food wasn't cooked to order it was just sort of given to you once you ordered it ... it was confusing. This location is much better. Also, they have good beers here!

Ezyl5DxGILhDlL2GeVzUvg.text: I love this type of food so was very excited to go to Bodean's but it was a MASSIVE disappointment. The food was so tasteless and sloppy. The pulled pork was dry and the chips were burnt. It you want great American Style food closer to home try Red Dog Saloon in Hoxton Sqaure.

tHAauE18lv7SRiqCqJqhqw.text: Meat, meat and more meat seems to be the mantra held at Bodean's at Tower Hill. Like its Soho brethren, Bodean's Tower Hill also has a less formal, take away eating area upstairs with the more comfy lounge and cushioned backed chairs downstairs. Small, silver coated pigs heads coat the wall, probably a testament to all of the meat soon to be consumed in the next meal. Either way, I have to give a thumbs up to their food once again, with the ribs I think improving since my last visit as the meat was soft and full of flavour even though I wanted to have more of their spicy (it wasn't that spicy) chipotle BBQ covering the meat. Their pulled pork was a little bit more disappointing this time as it just wasn't as moist as I remembered it though tasty nevertheless. Completed stuffed after this meal, Bodean's Tower Hill still satisfies and even has a number of great deals during the week including a £10 all you can eat rib-fest sure to please even the hungriest of meat-eaters.

6yAiU7Rj9M2JUji5VdsMdw.text: make sure you eat the whole plate! or get it boxed when your ready to go! :D

BUylTSWPbS9APidmh0U9jQ.text: Great place to eat if you want a laid back, stomach busting type of meal. The service is excellent (American customer service standards), and the food is plentiful and meaty! I recommend the pulled pork, a cold beer and the key lime pie for dessert

NZHObUG_uuI6HRK5L2DNGA.text: Made for everyone with a desire for the ultimate American BBQ experience. Make sure you try the hot chicken wings as well as the chili-cheese-fries.

vJkDaj09_xaPPitVD2mKdA.text: The main dining area for this Bodeans is downstairs (as is the kitchen) and the minute you start down the stairs that BBQ aroma floats up to meet you. No aperitif can work better than that. The decor is very typical of the other Bodeans and the big screens, which I find a little distracting, are on either side of the restaurant. Still a nice cosy warm atmosphere, friendly and attentive service. Chatting about rib combo experiences along Blouberg Beach restaurants, it was decided we will make up our own combo.The first thing our waiter did when he heard our order was to move us from a table for 2 to a table for 4 :-)The lamb ribs were superb, tender and tasty as were the Baby Back pork ribs, smoky and juicy. I was very disappointed with the beef ribs that were dry and so tough I had to slice the meat off the bone. That is a sacrilege for any rib eater as fingers are the order of the day.The extra BBQ sauces on the table, in different flavours, were good. I do recall some chips and coleslaw as well but did not try any, although it looked fresh.I would certainly go again as there are a few others bit on the menu that caught my eye and the ribs were ever so moreish.

pbMIhKLwz1biSnyMu1oK_w.text: Unbelievably rude. Like being surrounded by ignorant French cats riddled with disdain. Don't try to book a table, because you'll be told you can't. You can, it's clearly a game they play to while away the lonely hours between self congratulatory about how cool they are. The food? Doesn't matter, because you'll be left with a bitter taste in your mouth long after the cursory and fleeting enjoyment of burnt ends dissipates

pAhXCgvqEjQLj0drxR1Xpg.text: Good beer selection and great barbecue food within London, which is rare.

oWciI0q-P_Plegkztu9iUQ.text: Massive fan of this BBQ chain!I have already declared my undying love for Bodeans in a review for the Soho branch so I'll spare you all the gory details again.When this branch first opened I was exstatic as my boyfriend's office is right by Tower Bridge so when ever we feel lazy about dinner we come here. Pretty much the same deal as the Soho branch but the diner was a bit of a let down as it wasn't very well laid out. However they've recently redone the diner and it's amazing! Cute little booths and a fantastic looking bar area, where you can enjoy a beer with ribs and wings.I LOVE BODEANS!

rKpk-jOmhdICrdiyw3lhag.text: Wasn't sure what to expect with the mixed reviews.I enjoyed it though. Went here on a Saturday night, made a reservation so managed to skip the short line and walk straight to our table, which was nice for a Sat night.Service was a little iffy at times, especially at the beginning but as the restaurant began to empty out, the service somewhat did improve.Food-wise we ordered the mixed platter, out of which I enjoyed the baby back ribs the most and from the starters, the chicken wings in bbq sauce! yummy Apart from those the chicken and pulled pork was a bit bland, compared to what it should taste like.Also - they serve Pepsi and not Coke, I dont know why? The cocktails are good though :)I will try the Soho branch when I'm next in need of a meat fix!I actually wanted to give this place 3.5 starts, but am new to yelp and havent figured that out yet!

j9yBJ360g3vbcJIvcg8Lsw.text: I adore this restaurant. I come here every time I come to London. It's got a great atmosphere, the food is amazing, the staff are really friendly and they are always playing kick ass classic rock over the sound system. It's seriously the manliest restaurant in London

uqGMW0FhbpXQZav3Psbedw.text: Let's start with the positive; nice clean dining room in the basement and it does what it says on the tin. BBQ.The service well I have never been that impressed with. After trying this BBQ for the second time I have noticed a pattern..if the wait staff is busy then they will say they are out of it. Out of cornbread then you see they see clearly dishing it out to other patrons and out of dessert if they want you to give up your table.Foodwise I they cook pulled pork well, sort of bland but there is a selection of sauces. Ribs are nothing to rave home about but if you are craving cheap meat and rootbeer after a night on the town...well you might have a more exciting (less sober) review

bEKZI_3DTaH-4w7nSVV-Cg.text: We were seated downstairs and had a problem with the waitress.  The manager quickly reseated us and our new waiter was great!  Food was plenty and very yummy!  Will go back the next time we are here!  Pork ribs were wonderful!

VdFMihCXdcqgIJfNuGfHMw.text: Coming from barbecue country in the United States I was surprised to find a place like this right in the City of London. A group of friends and I came here for lunch one day and the food was excellent. They do all the regular barbecue styles and treats that would be expected, and it looks like they had NFL games on during the weekend maybe. They also have a good selection of beers. The only downside was that the server was terrible at his job, and it took us 30-45 minutes to get our tickets, and then another 20 to get them fixed. I would definitely eat here again if I'm in London and craving American barbecue.

EVD3yi9sspz0cb6RPCLUHg.text: One of my old reviews from March this year.Been waiting for awhile to sample the bbq food here and got the opportunity when a party of 12 went here for my 30th birthday, despite the big party the service was really friendly and very professional, although they hit us with a £40 service charge (which we asked to be halved), anyway before i get carried away with all that let's concentrate on the important bit, the food.For starters i had the half dozen chicken wings with a hot chipotle sauce which was finger lickin' good, wings were golden brown and sauce was smokey and tangy, in between courses i supped on there own brand of beer which was very good, and of course sampled a couple of bourbon's, so on to main course, i went for the burnt ends and fries with a side order of onion rings, the ends where magnificent, succulent, smokey and juicy just what burnt ends should taste like, fries where average, but tasty as were the onion rings, but the burnt ends was the main event, melt in mouth stuff, superb.The bill worked out about £35 a head, which isn't bad at all, but all i would say is the drinks is where it hits you in the pockey, especially if you like your cocktails and whiskey.so our overall experience was a good one, and will be going back to sample the rest of the menu real soon, if you have never been, put it on your to do list.

LK7eTPHZT0tFIx558ZlCJw.text: What a sad little Bodeans!  Ok, so you may know that I have an epic love affair with the soho location, so we thought perhaps all Bodeans would be similar and lovely and all that rigamaroll, and I met fellow yelper Suzanne at this one for some BBQ bliss.  well.well, it's just a little sad.  There's no oomph, no dirty-on-purpose Americana kitsch in the deli area, it had formica countertops and left me feeling a little empty.  You see, I don't just go to Bodeans to eat with my stomach, I also like to feast my face on tackily dressed Americans watching sports games (hockey, football, baseball, none that have any importance here) in that same kind of way that going to WalMart at 3am is the best time ever... you just end up feeling like a supermodel by comparison with the surroundings.  Not to say that everyone from America that visits Bodeans is ugly, I'm sure you're all delightful, you just aren't afraid to bring a little sweatpant action out of the house, and I salute you for that.... from afar... via a text message to my friend that's sitting right next to me... I'm getting off-topic.  But the food is just as good as the other locations, so for that, you get a gold star.  But I still crave the whole experience, not just city workers in suits... so for that, I'm afraid my Bodean's of choice is still soho.  Because let's face it, it just isn't a BBQ unless you're sitting next to Joe Sixpack.  And for those Joe Sixpacks at home playing a drinking game... Maverick.

GHTbsln7FrDe4k1Bo-FvCw.text: Bodean's has become a regular treat at our office and it's not hard to see why.Generous portions of smoked meats (their pulled pork is particularly good), plenty of American beer on offer, great staff and a combination of classic rock radio and ESPN sport to complete the ambience.The only things that could be done better are that beers are quite often not available, and portion size is quite variable  you don't know until you get there whether your meal will be merely generous or truly gutbusting.

ZTCwgXolS2X55knNVLJI6A.text: It's competent. Having experienced a lot of US BBQ while I lived there I can't honestly say that this is amazing. It's like a fairly pricey and somehow even-more-contrived TGI Fridays. The meat is cooked, though when you order don't be surprised that if 45 minutes later you are still waiting for your food and even when it arrives, it's not what you ordered. Luckily we got something fancier than we ordered at no extra charge- the waiter was very apologetic and I almost feel guilty saying it but it was late and it was wrong. It worked out alright for us but evidently this isn't always the case, sounds like there's something systemically wrong in the way they're running the place.I resent having to pay so much for the drinks! So there's Blue Moon, Brooklyn Lager etc and I understand these aren't quite as common as Carling and Fosters but they're really not so rare that you could mark them up quite so much. I didn't appreciate that, especially as they're trying so hard to go for the dive/ sports bar theme. There's not much in the way of a reasonably priced drink on the menu. The food was okay, could have been better seasoned but I'll hold back on judgement since I didn't get what I asked for so I can't really comment on that. I'll go back, definitely because it wasn't an unpleasant experience I just felt really underwhelmed and anticlimactic about the whole thing.

Yg4J0cVKYFX764ttP_Laeg.text: Best BBQ this side of the pond. Coming for the Southern US I consider myself a bit of a BBQ snob. This is by far the best that I have found outside of the United States. Went on a weekday at about 3 pm so the restaurant was empty and we got the best table right away. Server was attentive without being overbearing and quick. Ordered pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries and an order of burnt ends for the table. The fries were AMAZING!! If Tower Bridge wasn't visible in the distance I could almost believe that I was in Georgia. Sandwich was decent, the burnt ends were a bit mediocre. Give me cornbread with cracklins' any day. Multiple games on the televisions and staff were more than willing to change to game that we wanted to watch. Mixed drinks prices were outrageous, but the atmosphere and food (minus burnt ends) made me feel a little closer to home.  Also appreciate the takeaway so I can eat my BBQ at home in my sweats in front of the Telly.

x4PtAjD7Co51zqMQN5tHlQ.text: 16 oz burger?  Check.Pickles on the side?  Check.Copious quantities of chicken salt on chips?  Check.Side order of onion rings?  Check.Food served in baskets?  Check.Mid-afternoon siesta required after eating all of the above?  Hell yes.Dinner required after eating this for lunch?  Hell no.One of the better restaurants in the area.  I sidle on in here on a regular basis and order the above (sidenote:  sidling is an underutilized form of motility).  £12 later (ok, so it's not cheap) I sit at the table with my colleagues who look bemused and somewhat disgusted at the amount of food I am shoveling into my mouth.  What can I say, eating is one of my strengths and I am unappreciated in my own time.This is a decent go at the "American meat meat and more meat" class of food (I'm not sure what the technical term is but that seems as good as any).  My only complaints are the costs of the extras (£1 to add cheese on your burger?), and that the pulled pork bun is a little tasteless.  Maybe someone should tell the cook it's OK to add at least ONE salad item to a sandwich.I have to give extra plaudits for whatever the mystery pink sauce is that comes with the chips.  After a massive meal, I would normally  have room, but that stuff is so calorie laden that I can barely eat any of it.  It's like a McDonald's thickshake made out of mayonnaise....mmmm...McDonald's mayo thickshake...This place gets pretty busy on Fridays so you might want to call ahead if doing takeaway or book if staying in.  I haven't been to the downstairs restaurant area so I'm not sure what that's like.

f3JEGW-hwlwFxHMTfDuMEA.text: Some of the best barbecue I've had outside of the States. The ribs were great, the chicken respectable. Beer selection is good and focuses (exclusively?) on American breweries, especially Sierra Nevada and some of the macros (Coors in particular). Pleasant ambiance, decent prices. They show lots of sporting events so it would be fun to come here for that. Worth a visit more for the barbecue than the beer, but the beer is a nice plus.

-GBShNrDT5rEgls1sqe63g.text: I was drawn to this place based on a message board posting that said Bodean's shows good old fashioned American sporting events.  My plan was, head there round 6:00pm, watch the end of a "football (soccer)" match, have a drink or two and watch some MLB around 9:00.  This all sounded pretty good in my head.Showed up at 6:00, sat at the bar, and ordered, to my surprise, Eagle Rare Single Barrel Bourbon on the rocks (this is my go to back home).  Ordered up some food, burnt ends with coleslaw and cornbread.  The burnt ends were good, however a large part of my portion was actually just some chunks of brisket that didn't make the brisket plate.  The bits that were actual burnt ends were spectacular and had a rich, smokey taste.  Slathered in bbq sauce, the meat was decent.  The slaw was mid range, tasted better with extra pepper and some Cholula.  The cornbread was less than desireable, pretty hard and dry and lacked any real discernible corn flavor.  Enjoyed the meal with a Brooklyn lager and polished off an anchor steam before I was through.All that being said, I finished eating and drinking around 7:30ish.  I was sitting at the bar with one or two people that came and went.  I figured I could sit around for another hour and a half and have some more 'Murica beers, but the place was kind of a downer.  There were no loud mouth soccer hooligans during the arsenal game and the whole place seemed to be staffed by either French or Romanian women.  I went expecting a bbq and sports bar and got bbq from a place that had sports sometimes.  I hear the other locations are larger, probably make my way to one of them eventually.

uHE3A03QTqulcEzBf8zwMQ.text: I think this is probably the best barbecue in London. Good job replicating an American Sports bar with good selection of American beers.

DZUNO0NeH4tF7kaoXMFRSQ.text: A decent taste of America in London. For Yanks abroad this is a nice break from bland English food, though most of the things on the menu will likely shave years off your heart's lifespan.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Veggie Burger
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Chicken of some variety.

SJ7O0YI7hdH0ceLEFlf7qQ.text: Let's start with the positive; nice clean dining room in the basement and it does what it says on the tin. BBQ. The service well I have never been that impressed with. After trying this BBQ for the second time I have noticed a pattern..if the wait staff is busy then they will say they are out of it. Out of cornbread then you see they see clearly dishing it out to other patrons and out of dessert if they want you to give up your table. Foodwise I they cook pulled pork well, sort of bland but there is a selection of sauces. Ribs are nothing to rave home about but if you are craving cheap meat and rootbeer after a night on the town...well you might have a more exciting (less sober) review

T-pnwTbEqtXcbhP5q9MshQ.text: Quite close to Tower Hill and the Tower of London, this Bodean's is slightly different from the Clapham branch in that this one is split-level with a more restaurant feel downstairs and a diner upstairs: it also has an excellent value take away menu. To give you an idea on prices a pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and fries is £5.75, and an 8oz burger and fries to take away is £7.50, the take away prices are typically about 50p-£1 cheaper. I had the  chicken, pulled pork & grilled smoke sausage combo with fries and coleslaw for £14.95. Realistically it would probably have fed two people! It was all very tasty, good value and I washed it down with a bottomless £2.50 fountain diet coke. Recommended for meat-eaters, but veggies better beware! The Bodean's Classic Macaroni Cheese contains smoked chicken! There are a couple of fish dishes: tuna steak and shrimp dinner both are served with coconut rice, but not a big choice.

x5071KUzN5dhc9Kxs0RgGg.text: Desperately searching for somewhere to have a meal even mildly reminiscent of a home-cooked Thanksgiving meal, a few my friends and I booked Bodeans in Tower Hill. Full disclosure: we looked everywhere else in the hope that there were spaces, but in the end we had to take the last remaining table and rely on hope alone that they might have an inkling of how to replicate a decent meal for us poor, lonely, family-less saps on arguably the most pleasant holiday of the year. Holy shit did we get that wrong....Firstly, my cheery "Happy Thanksgiving" directed at the hurried waiter was returned with total puzzlement at what I was saying. It took 3 repeats to get him to fumble some sort of response that was more of a gurgle than anything else. We then realized (because he said it) that it was because he was Greek and they don't have Thanksgiving in Greece.... fair enough, it's not your thing, I understand.... And then there was the food... a massive (granted) undercooked turkey leg with soggy skin and less flavor than clean air, freshly boiled and rubbery ham slices that I can only presume had been candied, slices of turkey breast that crumbled at the merest vibration, stuffing which can only have been a corn muffin broken up in chunks, and topped off (literally) with a fishbowl of brown sugar water with a few slivers of onion and other species happily swimming about.The pumpkin pie looked to be the only thing that was home made, and that's only because the crust had that gnarled and crumbled look that can only come out of an amateur kitchen. That and the filling came out of a can, which I grant you is how most people make their pumpkin pie but we chose to poo poo it regardless.I've been to the Bodeans in Fulham and had a hugely disappointing pulled pork sandwich, so I will be avoiding this chain like a Turkey with big plans to make it past the last Thursday in November....Alternatives: Pitt Cue, Blues Kitchen, Big Easy, ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!

mCC06qDyFqRGoPi7hnnx3A.text: I'm just going to say it... I'm kinda surprised about some of the glowing reviews of this place!  That said, upon first finding it a few years ago I probably would have glowed just as much.I'm from the south of the US originally, so I like my BBQ, and having been in the UK for a while was shocked to hear that there was a BBQ place in London.  (I know, I know, London has everything... it still took me by surprise for some reason!)  Upon first inspection the place seemed fine... exciting even, mirroring that BBQ joint vibe, but on a larger scale than what I would normally see.  I've been several times now, and tried many of the dishes (sharing platters, chicken, ribs, burnt ends, etc.), and while never that bad they aren't normally that great either to be honest... they just seem to be lacking that certain something that sets a great BBQ joint apart.The food prices aren't terrible for London, although £7 for a Blue Moon does sting a bit!The place is clean, the staff normally friendly, and it is certainly jumping (extra points for showing some NHL games!)... it helps to have a reservation if you're going at peak times, but I normally prefer to make the trek to Dukes Brew & Queue (near the Haggerston Overground stop) over this place these days... the ribs between the two are simply night and day!So I think this place is about expectations... if you need a BBQ fix or something a bit novel then by all means give it a go, but now that I'm over the novelty of it I personally find myself going elsewhere when it comes to the food alone.

MCp0etqnzlS2y0q8DuoYYQ.text: I cannot rate my experience here highly enough!  Everything was so efficient, from the table allocation system (more on that in a minute) to the speed of service at our table.The food was delicious and plentiful as always; I had the pulled pork meal and my OH had a burger.  We shared sides of onion rings and burnt ends (highly recommended!)  They forgot to sub my fries for sweet potato fries, but the waiter noticed and brought an extra portion for no extra charge before I'd even clocked it (was too busy taking a picture of the giant feast, obviously!)As for the table allocation, we knew we'd be in for a wait (as is the norm with restaurants where you can't book), but they take your phone number and text you when your table is ready.  We popped next door to the Wetherspoons and watched the queue countdown on my phone, turning it into a drinking game!  Despite being 12th in the queue, our table was ready in 30 minutes and we returned to be seated straight away.All the staff were lovely and the atmosphere in the restaurant was great.  Top night!

W6116fhdavk01Z84lwpaLQ.text: Despite hearing mixed reviews about this place, I braved the wind and rain out of hope for some delicious bbq. The visit didn't get off to a great start as, despite there being plenty of free tables, we couldn't be seated as the staff member front of house was tied up with a difficult customer on the phone. We were soon at the front of a long queue leading out of the restaurant. We were eventually seated by a different staff member who just came in to start her shift. If she hadn't come in who knows how long we'd have been waiting for! They either need to move the phone somewhere else or have another member of staff who can step in in this scenario Anyway, enough of the whinging. Onto the good stuff. Lots of American beers that you don't really see were present (lookin' at you, Lone Star) with wine, cocktails and milkshakes all making appearances. Some of these beers are pretty expensive for the size of the bottle but I can only assume that's due to the difficulty of sourcing them. We started with buffalo wings and elected to go all out with the dreaded Diablo sauce. The wings were pretty big, with a good amount of meat on them. The exterior was crispy and the inside juicy. Perfectly cooked chicken. And the sauce. Oh my god the sauce. The sauce was amazing. The interplay with the spice and the tomato and the blue cheese was beautiful. BEAUTIFUL I TELLS YA!I've had some pretty amazing pork ribs in my time and I have to say these were pretty good. They weren't quite up to the standard of the St Louis dry rub you can get in The Big Easy in Covent Garden but they weren't too far off. The baby back ribs here were even closer to that rib nirvana. Now let's talk about sides. Any menu that has creamed corn on is a winner in my book. Plus you gotta try the burnt ends. They're so tender and the sauce they come in just brings out so much flavour. Probably not great enough to have on its own for a main course but as a side it works wonders but at £9.95 you kinda expect it to. That is the one real downside of the place: the price. While not everything is massively overpriced, there are a few items that are and I don't remember seeing anything particularly cheap. But hey, at least you're getting decent food tl;dr bbq food is pretty good but not the best, apart from the chicken wings cos they're perfect. Minus point: tad on the expensive side

PGrXfexYhxqKkSVgi9cpIA.text: If you want meat, Bodeans usually hits the mark with its busy Americana atmosphere. Pulled pork, ribs and chicken are all good and there's a good range of American beers to go with it too.  What I appreciate the most about this place is, no matter how busy they are, they will try to find you a table and service is quick and with a smile.

qDRvbsIYeyLT2JaTWyFXzQ.text: Great Barbecue in LONDON!  This place was a short stroll from our hotel and we were drawn in by the smell which doesn't happen too often for me in London. My husband really wanted to try this place at the suggestion of his colleagues so in we went.  I ordered a half slab of the baby back ribs which came with fries and coleslaw and my husband ordered the pulled pork which was also accompanied by coleslaw and fries.  I also ordered a Stella Artois, and too late discovered that they had Dogfish on the menu - an American beer dubbed "The New World IPA".  That cracked me up!

-ins1mtMPhZ4oiQ6-6H8Lg.text: This needs to be reclassified as a BBQ restaurant  not simply  American! we skipped over this place for dinner thinking it was traditional burgers and beers but stopped in after seeing the BBQ neon sign. amazing beer and liquor  selection and the food is amazing!

KILZZJRD3lkhP53Ou2-qlQ.text: The other half insisted we travel all the way here for barbecue food, and I'm honestly thrilled we did. We ordered the buffalo wings (diablo sauce of course, what's the point of buffalo wings if they don't wake your sinuses up?) to start, and a platter to continue - everything was fabulous, and I'm LIVING for the burnt ends. Absolutely beautiful food, almost as good as Texas ;)

2Fy4LJ7fwgKSCMLt_N8w3w.text: Hit Bodean's up for barbecue prior to heading to the Tower of London.  While we ordered straight up barbecue, it was just alright.  We ordered the burnt ends and the ribs.  The ribs were passable, but the burnt ends were alright.  Their Chipotle barbecue sauce was good, and made everything else tasty.  The macaroni and cheese didn't taste like it was from scratch -- rather, it tasted gritty, like boxed macaroni and cheese.  Further, the cheese sauce was soupy.The highlight for me about Bodean's?  An amazing Bourbon selection.  First time I've had good Bourbon whilst in London.  I had the Hudson Baby Bourbon, and Buffalo Trace -- two quality Bourbons that go with barbecue.So will I be back?  Not for the food -- just the Bourbon!

AgtBUaWpvfok285j32be_g.text: Stumbled into Bodeans while visiting Tower of London. It was a cold, rainy, all-around miserable day and the smell of the barbecue called to us like it was the Pied Piper. We weren't disappointed.We were seated in the downstairs dining room, which was cheerful and full of chatty people on their lunch break. From the sound of it, we were the only Americans in the group (we diligently tried to avoid American food while here, but hey - BBQ). We both got the pulled pork and it was AMAZING. The magical pork forces aligned to make all the damp clothes and rain-speckled glasses forgotten. The sauce options were all great, though I wish there had been more ON the pork. But I can handle self-serve. Good chips, great service!

ua85pKrOJ5dAmz-IgMlasw.text: As an American visiting English friends in London, one of the things you do is go to an BBQ restaraunt.  Anyway, our English friends were interested to see what we Yanks thought about it.  It was actually pretty darn good BBQ.  It was a nicer than average setting as well, definitely not a traditional BBQ place like you'd see in the

S6TxOYgMUoRWCkHAOIkPMg.text: Comfortable and friendly. This particular locale, located around the corner from the Tower Hill tube stop, has a proper American Bar feel in the front, with booth-like table areas in the back and in a surprisingly vast area downstairs. I went here twice: once when a little piece of New York hit me and that impulse had me looking at the takeaway menu after a late work night.It wasn't the impulse for American food (which I never ate in NY, either). It was the desire for a real takeaway meal that wasn't crap. This place delivered (no pun intended), with, as it turns out, tasty and spicy Jerk Chicken.   When you're tired and want to eat without cooking, is the choice always between eating cheap and greasy takeaway, cooking, or starving?  No, it's not.  Anymore.A second time I came back to eat in, sitting at the bar to try the Burnt Ends and an ale called Stone Levitation. This turned out to be pleasing enough to remind me to write this review. That and the very friendly service. It's not very London at all for staff to regularly ask you if you need anything else and notice when your glass is empty. I was shocked when the bartender was actually chatting up patrons and being friendly without being overwhelming.  This is the sort of thing that makes clients go back.  And I plan to do that. If there's any -1, it's the radio / noisiness.  I guess I wasn't looking for anything THAT authentic. ;-)   But you can't have it all, can you.For a moment, I felt like I was in New York. I'm hoping to relive that without having to book a flight, and now that I found this place, the airline companies are about to lose crazy air fare on me.

JNEAkCWlF6Hs5ZvYfaBpow.text: After 7 years of vegetarianism, I was ready to take the leap into meat-eating at this Bodeans.I went straight in and ordered the pulled pork, a dish so delicious that Jesus the Jewish carpenter would sell his virgin mother on the street to fork over for that shit.And it was disappointing.youtube.com/watch?v=oabc…...so disappointing.

fvVLgOIqllA-vCnR5yWySw.text: Pretty much A-OK.  I've had some pretty good BBQ in the good ol' US of A, and Bodean's is like an imitation of those places that just isn't quite as good.  It's certainly not bad, and when I go in there I get my American fix for the month (always good to see some American football on tv to feel nostalgic).  The burnt ends are my favorite, but the other stuff is pretty decent as well.  The portions aren't the largest, but are probably civilized compared to "this will definitely make you fat" portions that BBQ places give you back home.So in short, Bodean's is a good place to go if you want BBQ and a little taste of America.  I haven't had anything better, so I keep going back...

ZpiX4QQmFbtVn2YT0854OA.text: I'm not really a meat orientated person - I came here on the behest of my siblings and in-laws - who LOVE their meat.  And if you also LOVE your meat, I would heartily recommend a meal at Bodeans.  Many of our party ended their pig-fest by wiping a dewy brow and declaring their meat-sweats had begun.Our evening started off not-so-well with spiky interaction from the front of house.  For the life of me, I cannot fathom why someone thought that would be an appropriate position for this woman - she was rude, blunt and had all the charm of a wooden spoon.  We were shooed away from an empty chair at the bar at one point, as 'the manager is sitting there'.  Right.  Obviously, the manager would prefer to keep his seat, rather than giving it up to a party of 6 paying customers.  The bartender wasn't much friendlier, however, the service was redeemed by our sweet and helpful waitress.  Food was pig-tastic - about 2/3 of the plate was meat!  However, my sister's burrito was sent back as it was cold, and my creamed corn was tepid at best.  This was made up for (slightly) by the beans which were uber-tasty (I recommend).  Generally it was a thumbs up all round, but sadly it didn't knock any of our socks off - maybe they were having an off day.  I have it on good authority (this good authority being my little sister, who is a mega pork fan and counts Bodeans amongst her favourite places in the world) that the Tower Hill branch is not a patch on her favourite Bodeans in Clapham - in terms of tastiness and service.  Maybe try there first?

XVVCVkrKxW-3AIM9V0bvxw.text: This was really disappointing.  Having discovered bbq in the States I was craving some pulled pork.  Went here before Christmas and the food was pretty awful - meat had no real flavour and only one of the sauses was any good.I'm sure it's great if you haven't eaten the real thing, but if you have, I'd give it a miss.

0pd54DHuScL71HUcx8S4-w.text: Bodean's reminds me of the Dallas BBQ chain in New York.  Maybe a tad better.   The BBQ is fine.  The burgers are way, way, way overcooked.  The fries (they are actually called fries here instead of chips) and pink sauce are nice.  The sports bar atmosphere with non-stop American football/baseball/basketball is perfect for the American looking for a fix after too much rugby, cricket, and darts.  Darts on TV??I'm not sure you should do this place for lunch.  Not unless you have a place to go and relax while you digest the 5000 calories you just ate.

3TZ5f6zQp9W_XdniacFBhw.text: Service is alfwul American diner with unhappy unfriendly unhelpful staff.Food is very overpriced for what it is, would rather go gaucho for a steak for the same price!Only thing worth eating on the menu is the beef ribs (£20 for two!)Will not be going back

RAE8zUKDeu3bHnlCTAdkIQ.text: For a tenner you can't expect much, but I was pleasently supprised.Ribs, pulled pork, fries and coleslaw plus a beer! Decent portions, good food and nice clean place. Friendly staff so well worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

SJbfJqPyOK0FsW0z5Q2LZA.text: I went here for my brothers 21st birthday the other week and what a brilliant way to kick start the celebrations! The decoration made us feel like we were at an American steakhouse and the food was mouth-watering. The staff were very friendly and always delivered with a smile. My only fault would be that it was very hot and stuffy downstairs, and a bit unusual to use a mixed gender toilet, but would definitely recommend to a party looking for an easy night out for good value and great atmosphere!

6wO1gotVnwhgpXYBeQQ3wg.text: While I love the BBQ, their substitution policy is absurd.  To swap a side item for a less expensive side, you are charged a substantial surcharge.  For example, swapping fries for beans will cost you an extra £1.75 for an item that is £.55 cheaper on the menu.  Crazy that the manager stood his ground and lost a £30 order.  He clearly has been instructed to give the "that's the policy" line.  Until their policy changes, I won't be back.

90CafUCi4SrySK9Soo83cA.text: I live in Southern California and have many great BBQ places to go to. Was very surprised to find this place near my hotel in London that was as good as most in the USA. The platter of ribs, burnt ends, chicken and pulled pork was delicious and they also have a nice selection of beers, which is always important at a BBQ place. Good smoke flavor on the meats and the sauces were both good. Service and prices very good as well.

pLdZ45Kf1NNWtPaFd9Y_tw.text: BBQ is my jam. Anything with meat really, so I was super excited when my friends suggested Bodean's for dinner as I had never gone. We ordered the cornbread muffins and onion rings, Bodean's sharing platter which comes with spare ribs and baby back ribs, burnt ends, pulled pork and chicken thighs, and fries.Service was quick and the casual vibe was great, but the food was a letdown. The pulled pork was dry and cold, the cornbread was too heavy, the fries were a bit soggy, and the ribs lacked in flavor. The chicken and burnt ends were probably the best selection of the platter.Maybe other Bodean's are better but I'm not entirely convinced by this one.

wMV7HT22l7UxxZQNXOgm1w.text: I hadn't been to Bodeans in a couple of years having found that the quality of the fare had gone down over subsequent visits. So with trepidation I joked to the missus that we should visit at lunch on a Saturday while nearby. She didn't realise I was kinda kidding and we ended there.To be fair, it's improved. It still has that silly hour and a half seating thing and the tables are still too small to take the horde of bottles on them when you arrive, but it was a solid meal.I had the pulled pork bun, while she had the trip tip sandwich. My pork was dry, but that was fixed using a bottle of BBQ sauce. The fries were good, as was the creamed corn. Even her tri tip was ok. It's redeemed itself in my eyes - I'm not at the stage where this is once again a destination restaurant, but if I'm in the area again I won't be cracking jokes about it.

M2aKl5Z67EVqgQ9s_Bg1tA.text: Ordered the 16oz burger, first time I've ever been asked if I wanted it well done or medium. One of the best bugers i've ever had. Not many chips, not as filling as i'd been preparing myself for but the taste made up for it. The combo of 1/4 chicken, pulled pork and ribs was in my opinion a small portion but very tasty. The service is best yet, they will literally go out of there way to do anything for you. Including free ice cream. Overall 4 stars due to portion sizes and table sizes.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Look at it!!!

qXVrMuelz2Lk99IZOObFCg.text: A charming take on American BBQ. The flavor was there, the ingredients were fresh and delicious. I also recommend the clam chowder, rarely seen in BBQ joints.

-Fy5A1IOIK8ijy3wS4j6-A.text: **This review is based on a catered lunch from Bodean's, but I am not sure where this catered service came from so I am selecting the closest one to my office.**In all honesty, they can do a lot better with their BBQ.  Although this is Kansas City-style and my palate comes from Texas (not to mention being around a BBQ pit all my life), they miss on the following 3 things which made for a disappointing experience:1. Their ribs were lightly smoked as it didn't have the bark (color) that is indicative of proper smoking.  Plus, ribs should leave a bite mark, but were a bit tough to bite through.2. Proper salsa should be thick and full of veg, peppers, spice, etc., not liquid and full of water.  And don't get me started on the guacamole - it was rubbish and probably came from a bag or can.  FYI go to Texas or Mexico for proper salsa.3. Their "burnt ends" did not look or taste like real burnt ends - they are just large cuts of fatty brisket (not appetizing).  KC BBQ is mostly pork-based so if you're going to try a brisket and offer burnt ends, learn from a Texan.The only positives were the chicken breast, coleslaw and pulled pork.  By the looks of the London BBQ scene, your best bet is to do it yourselves and enjoy the self-satisfaction I experience every time I BBQ.

Zv7tnwvrvidaKn0MuapGcA.text: Mixed bag here. There were some things i really liked, but some i didn't:To preface I'm an american who definitely has enthusiasm for bbq but was pretty much just here to watch nfl football. The good: - they broke their "schedule" to put on the game i wanted to see. - They had one of the better tap lists I've seen so far in my short stay in england.The bad: - the fact that all the tvs in the two story restaurant/bar have to play the same channel, which made them extremely reluctant to change it for probably the only people in the bar who were invested in an nfl team. When they did the game was in like 360p resolution which made it hard to follow. - they dont have bbq at all. I had ribs at this place and these ribs hadnt been anywhere near a smoker. They were most likely not slow cooked because they had little flavor and were pretty tough and dry. Honestly the worst ribs i've ever had. Also the ribs were mostly likely st. Louis style but were advertised as baby back. Appetizer selection was bad. The wings were REALLY expensive like 10£ for 6 and there wasn't anything that seemed snacky.If it wasn't for the service and the beer. I would have given this place 1 star but they get another one because if you want some good beer and to watch football in england this is your place. Just dont eat their disgusting food.

W5DSqiSWGOdWAZ-XXvwiDA.text: I've loved Bodeans every since I first visited a few years ago and I love it no less after this visit.6 of us including 2 out of town-ers who love Bodeans too went out for dinner and Bodeans was an obvious choice for a Bank Holiday weekend.Great drinks and fantastic food as always. The service is friendly but never overly so and that's appreciated by my party. The only thing I was a bit disappointed with were the Diablo wings. I've had them once before and I swear they were much more spicy the last time. You think Diablo and you want something that will melt your face. There was definitely no face melting occurring.Other than that, it was a fantastic evening. Game Dag special for £15 is a great deal. And I highly recommend it if you're there Sunday to Thursday.

znaAliqg5Y1mml740IundA.text: Good food and price for a restaurant  situated in such a touristic area (tower of London). The bbq mix and sauces were really good and big portions. As a bonus they had lots of screens so we could see the Roland Garros final :)

8u22MzRwVhNUsNViEl024Q.text: A little taste of America... yes please!  While it is not the best BBQ I have ever had...  I think Bodean's makes a valiant effort, more than any other restaurant that does BBQ (that I have been to so far).I was attracted by the Pulled Pork on the menu.  If there is one thing that I have missed since living here in the UK, it is a Pulled Pork Sandwich.  I'm not quite sure about the interior and it was a little too dark for my taste, but then again I wasn't on a romantic date.  Then again, I don't know who would take someone on a romantic date to a BBQ restaurant.  A BBQ restaurant is more of a "we've been together for awhile and I'm comfortable enough for you to see me wearing a bib, eating ribs with BBQ sauce all over my face" sort of date, but maybe that's just me.  On the table was a wooden condiment holder with ketchup, French's Mustard, Cholula Hot Sauce, and then their three BBQ sauces.  There was also a roll of paper towel... which you would find at any respectable BBQ joint in the states.Anyway I noticed a couple of things on the menu that caught my eye:  A&W Cream Soda, A&W Root Beer, Iced Tea, Clam Chowder, Cornbread, and creamed corn.  While I hadn't tried some of their versions of these items, I was just excited that they had it on the menu and were attempting them.  I ordered an iced tea with extra ice...  yes, it is because I am American.  It is probably a good idea that I had the extra ice because the tea was quite sweet and the extra ice mellowed it out a bit.  While I am a big fan of sweet tea, the kind of sweet of this iced tea wasn't quite the same...It took awhile for the waitress to come back and take my order because she thought I was waiting for someone...  While waiting there were two large, flat screen t.v.s so I could watch baseball, if I was interested in baseball.  I really wanted to try the clam chowder, but thought I probably wouldn't have much room for anything else, so I ordered the Pulled Pork Platter and a piece of cornbread.  What was amazing, was the speed at which that plate of food appeared on the table after I had ordered it.  While it was nice that it came out so fast because I was hungry, it made me question the quality of the food...When the waitress brought out my food, she did explain the condiments, which was nice and even tried to recommend one for my pulled pork.  I tried her recommendation for the vinegar based sauce, but I prefer my sauce to be a bit on the sweet and smokey side with a bit of spiciness to it, so the Smoked Hickory sauce was the one that I opted for.  The pulled pork does not come with sauce on it, which is nice if you want to choose your own sauce and how much of it.  The pork was tender and juicy, which was a little surprising seeing as how it did not come with sauce.The sides for the pulled pork were coleslaw and creamed corn.  You can change the sides, although the ones that cost a little more to substitute are marked.  The coleslaw was more like American coleslaw, not as heavy on the mayo, but could've used some seasoning like celery seed/salt as it was a bit bland.  The creamed corn...  well it wasn't exactly what I was expecting and I was hoping that I would love it, but I didn't.  I don't really know how to describe it...  you know that pistachio, creamy, jello salad thingy with unknown bits in it that you have probably had at a family reunion...  well it kind of had that consistency, but no pistachio, just cream and corn...The cornbread was nice.  It came out warm served with butter, and I got two pieces.  The waitress checked on me a couple times, which was nice and unexpected.  When I was finished, she brought some handwipes out, which should be on hand when you are eating BBQ.  Overall, I enjoyed parts of my meal...  I would go back, but I would probably substitute sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Iced tea, with extra ice
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Cornbread
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Pulled Pork Platter (coleslaw upper right and creamed corn lower right)

wR3p2tqjnyDA5hQxI7zvlA.text: Visited here for the first time for a birthday gathering in May. Welcoming atmosphere and decor was unique and fitting to this cuisine, we were sat downstairs on a large long table to the right. Service was slow and a little disjointed, with drinks being forgotten and waiting staff having a hard time understanding and communicating with us due to English not being their first language. Our food orders were eventually taken after several prompts but on arrival some had mistakes, but despite the poor service the food was very good. Tasty fresh fries, the burnt ends could do with a bit more burning but would definitely recommend anyway. The famous dry thunder chicken thighs were very nice but the diablo sauce although nice was not as spicy as I was led to believe or hoped although there was chilli sauce available on each table, although most bottles were empty when we hunted for more! The side salad I ordered with my chicken was basic salad leaves and two cherry tomatoes, this is very poor and disappointing and should be looked at.The portions were a good size so you definitely won't leave hungry!I will return to try some more dishes but perhaps another branch.

-K_YMj5P6OGI_lnNH5vXfA.text: I had to write a little review about Bodean's BBQ Restaurants, but I have to admit this is also acting as a form of protest that there ARE NO BRANCHES OUTSIDE LONDON and this is completely unacceptable to us northern carnivores! :)Anyway, ranting aside, if you're a fan of barbeque cuisine then Bodean's is definitely for you. They have 'baconnaise' for heaven's sake - how hadn't I heard of that before?! Not a fan of mayonnaise but very much a fan of anything with the essence of bacon added...As long as you don't mind brimmingly busy dining experiences (and stairs) then their Tower Hill branch is well worth popping in for a Soho Special (go large, or go home). Pretty much everything is served with coleslaw and fries. God bless the Americans.Tower Hill is the nearest underground station on the Circle & District lines. They also have restaurants in Soho, Clapham and Fulham. I'm hopeful that you get a jar of baconnaise to take home if you visit them all...

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. The 'Soho Special'

uaFKfCsiQcn83OFI1cpFyg.text: Bourbon and barbecue.  Bodean's is a little slice of the states.  Right around the corner from the hotel we were staying, we found ourselves at Bodean's a few times.  It has the feel of a typical American barbecue joint and even has Sam Adams and Coors on tap, not that I'll be drinking either of those.  They do have the best selection of American craft beer in bottles and a kick ass selection of bourbons.  I stuck with the Buffalo Trace which ran about the cost of most pints I had around town.  I made fast friends with the bartenders and they were helpful with tips and things to see and do around town.    BBQ is what to get here.  The Diablo wings were huge and spicy.  Now, when it comes to the BBQ I sampled, the burnt ends are a must and the best thing we had aside from the wings.  The pork bbq was also solid.  Sadly, the baby back ribs were weak and forgettable.  The Jamaican jerk ribs I grilled myself this week puts them to shame.  You'll want to pass on the ribs as they were tiny and had nothing going on.  Sides were good and there is a selection of different sauces on the table for you.This is also one of the best places around town to catch American sporting events and they often have them on the replay and happily put the games on for you.  The coed restrooms seemed odd to me, but when in Rome, er London...

EckMevbrQj_KXQ8CIZTm5g.text: Bodean's is a place that I have heard a lot about but had never eaten there until last week. The location was a good tourist spot, more or less opposite the Tower of London and in sight of Tower Bridge however I ate in the basement. with no windows.Having observed the fixtures and fittings and the logo of the company I decided to go for the babyback pork ribs and chips priced at £9.95. I rarely have ribs and I'm always disappointed but the amount of meat you get for the effort you have to go through in pulling it free from the bones. Overall I enjoyed Bodean's and will probably venture back someday.

m8gmzqW2-LK8SXN9hA9tpQ.text: I visited the Bodean's branch at Tower Hill with my family. We ordered the Bordean's Platter for 2 and the 1 lb beef burrito. The portion is big and was a little too much for the 4 of us. The platter is a good value for money. However, I find the food quite salty for my taste and the meat seems a little overcooked. However, the service is good and the ambience is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. 1 lb Beef Burrito

ta7f-wUE6DvVUvylTzOh5A.text: American style sports bar/BBQ smoke house! There was a great atmosphere when I went on a Thursday evening, fun and lively!! The food was nice, I had the baby back ribs (which have had great reviews) served with chips and slaw, overall the food was good but I was a little disappointed with the ribs, not as nice as ribs that I have had elsewhere, next time would have a burger or hot dog! The BBQ sauce they provide is very good!

OvbxIxhjtkGqxW41LT927w.text: The pulled pork soft and moist with burnt ends full of pungent flavours as the spare ribs are nicely grilled on the outside giving that cajun char taste as it is soft  dripping moisture on the inside. The burgers are succulently cooked with cheese melting from the heat of the patty that just oozes juices from the first heavenly bite. I could go on but I need to stop.This place has become my go to place when I went to pig out, watch a game , turn fat, over eat, go for a meat coma.  Now each of the three times I have gone I have never finished my plates but I am starting to realise no man can finish a platter for two to himself with a strawberry milkshake straight after having six pieces of Diablo chicken wings as a stater and still going for a chocolate fudge cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream!Maybe fourth time lucky who knows, but I'm happy to say I will give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Gone for the bodeans platter but can this be finished?
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. 1/4 chicken, pulled pork and half rack of ribs with chips and coleslaw.
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. 16oz of pure beef juiciness with cheese melting in the middle.

CoT7NjKrIs_ujKQWaKoKhg.text: Shockingly succulent pulled pork. Utterly forgettable babyback ribs... ones made nominally better by a decent house chipotle barbeque sauce.The priciest pint Blue Moon I've ever consumed... and some NFL (American football) on the telly.And really... that's about all one needs to know about Bodean's. No. Seriously.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Pulled pork meal
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Half-rack of babyback ribs

hTDUiuSWt9bRdd5f0YrSpg.text: The BBQ, pulled pork, and the rest of the "American" food was pretty good.  Service was a disaster.  They brought us items we didn't order, then tried to ignore us and stick us with them.  Otherwise, if you're hankering for some BBQ, ti's not bad.  I was disappointed I couldn't get any English beer, but I guess only American beers is part of their image.

IBevOIVDuXcmOskG0NM34w.text: If someone told me I'd be eating good barbecue in London, I would've said they were crazy. Ok, crazy me then! Previous reviews looked good, so we thought we'd try it.Wow, we were really impressed! It wasn't just good BBQ for England, it was downright good BBQ period.We had the 1/2 baby back rib platter, the pulled pork sandwich, and the 1/2 beef burnt ends/pulled pork. All were excellent, the fries were crispy, and didn't get soggy by the end of meal. Coleslaw was creamy - we didn't necessarily care for that, but it was good coleslaw nonetheless.I was also very impressed by how they served my Diet Coke - in a big glass with ICE! and plenty of it! Yes, American style, haha!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Food for 3
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Pulled pork sandwich
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Brisket

a1sg7h1Wn-gz4uIrCjWA6g.text: This is my second visit to this restaurant, today I had the Nachos Supreme. Others in my party had buffalo chicken sandwich, cheese burger and baby back ribs. The meals were delicious.  The service and ambience is great. The restaurant is kid-friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

6yDe66h5K4FArglU-FO7sg.text: Thank you... thankyouthankyouthankyou.Thank you for keeping your kitchen open, heaven forbid, after 9PM on Boxing Day, also known as fake Christmas in Canada and the UK. After being blown away by the lack of eating establishments serving food at this time, Bodean's actually found its way into our bellies twice... unintentional the second time around, we're still thankful for their service.Hey, we're Americans, so we're gonna judge barbecue like Americans, i.e. harshly. So I'd call the food itself admirably four-star. It's real barbecue, done very nicely. We went for the Soho Special, a sandwich with half burnt ends and half pulled pork. Really tasty, and the regular size is more than enough for one person.Also, gotta credit the fries (chips, whatever). The seasoning is really good and makes for more than just a thoughtless side dish. My wife liked the coleslaw so much, she put it on her sandwich.I give the fifth star for exceptional service and friendliness. And openness. Open is good.

_uVABPbCvKXtedfRX5DUgA.text: Disclaimer : Just had a drink here, so I can't speak for the food.I LOVE Bodeans. This is one of my 2 favourite BBQ chains in London and I normally visit the OLd Street branch that I absolutely love.We were in a late evening walk and wanted some coffee on Saturday evening. All the coffee shops had shut, but we saw a Bodeans that was open. I adore their espresso martinis and it seemed like a great idea for the caffeine fix we were craving.The hostess at the door, said they didn't have seats. We said we just wanted a quick drink and we're fine with standing at the bar, so she let us in, while a queue formed outside.The bartenders were quite friendly, but service took some time and when the drinks came, they were a complete disappointment. Nothing like the rich, creamy and sweet espresso martini, I am served at the old street  branch, the coffee was bad and bitter and had been standing for 2 long and had been diluted. Fortunately with my Bodeans card, I get a free Fireball cinnamon whisky and that helped me get a pleasant after taste.We also decided to use the washrooms downstairs, as we wanted to walk for another couple of hours. We were pointed downstairs and that's when we realised that the half the downstairs was empty and yet there were people being made to queue in the cold outside. It wasn't like they had set aside space for a large party or that they were understaffed.It just left a bad impression overall and we will never go back to this branch.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Takeaway options
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. The bar #LiveLifeLikeLDN

EuC27WGecadNcZZT1s8Xbg.text: Meats to die for! "Diablo" not hardly as far as heat goes but delicious nonetheless.  Great Mac & and cheese.  Played old school like 80s R&B that took me back.  Service great!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

6HZsJPQmTj_L0KvmFsH5sw.text: This is some of the best barbecue I have had in my life. I'm from Texas and we have some really great barbecue in Texas, but the Barbecue at Bodean's was amazing...lots of flavor, fall off the bone tender, generous portions sizes...not a place you should miss when visiting London. Service is lacking but that appears to be the norm in London. You can't get service like in the states.

LJp-QoFPNRr917fPqWq1lw.text: First if all, we're from Kansas City, Bodean's gets its inspiration. In KC, there are easily 100 BBQ restaurants for a population of 2 million; in London, there are six.Bodean's is pretty good, all things considered. We had the pulled pork, pork ribs, brisket, and burnt ends. The ribs were fall off the bone, pulled pork was decent, brisket was tasty (thicker sliced, as it should be), but the burnt ends weren't the best KC burnt ends we've ever had (but better than anyone in Texas could do, mind you).I also had the chicken wings. The hottest flavor, which I was assured people have actually cried eating. They weren't so hot, but compared to mushy peas, they were excellent.

tr8nX6c09yB61LBQEgoxSg.text: We were seated as soon as we walked in as it wasn't that busy (around 8:30pm on a Monday night) and our server was as attentive as can be. We went with the large buffalo wings to share for a starter, with the BBQ sauce option, and I have honestly never seen wings so big. They were very tasty and hit the spot nicely.I opted for a beef burger which was absolutely fantastic. The patty was huge, which makes me thank my lucky stars I decided not to double up as I struggled to finish it just as a single! It was excellently flavoured and the salad gave that nice satisfying crunch required to make a good burger. The red onions were particularly well placed, adding a pleasant tang with every bite.It took a while to get the bill but other than that, this is an amazing restaurant with lots on offer no matter your tastes.

W_oOzc2xBVt2Q8l-i1yOVQ.text: Good BBQ, nice atmosphere with blues music. Staff was very friendly and prices reasonable. Nice to find a decent BBQ establishment in London close to my hotel. Will definitely return before I leave town.

s9SuKwxar4PuU7ONiEuntA.text: The bbq was like butter the meat fell right off the bone I felt like I was back home in the south

paTlM6L4vKZhtDJqjA4h4g.text: I've been to Bodean's twice now.  I think they try to cater to US visitors as they show a lot of US sports on the tvs.  I ordered a bottle of Woodchuck cider (from VT) and this is the only time I've seen an American cider in London.  The first time I went, I ordered ribs and mac and cheese for takeaway (take out/to go in American speak) and I didn't like either.  The ribs were tough and chewy and the mac and cheese was quite dry and not very cheesy.  I didn't really plan to go back, but on my most recent trip, my co-workers wanted to go back as it was open later than any of the other restaurants in the vicinity of our hotel.  I ordered burnt ends, which came with fries and coleslaw.  The burnt ends were better than the ribs were, but were not comparable with good burnt ends in the states.When we had finished, our server didn't come back for quite a while and the restaurant was shutting down.  Finally she came over and asked if we wanted the bill and we said yes.  She said it was typical for them not to bring the check until we asked for it.  But I'm not sure how we are supposed to ask for it when she was nowhere to be seen!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Burnt ends

f2N25Mnhh54UKVv2rLqWLA.text: This was the worst BBQ I have had in my life. If you just want a piece of fat that is peppered to all hell then this is you. My girlfriend and I split a platter with 2 kinds of ribs, sausage, burnt ends, chicken, cole slaw, and fires. The sausage was pretty good but that was the only thing that was edible. The drinks were horrible and if you are a tourist they seat you down stairs. I would recommend MacDonalds before wasting your time and money here. Our meal was £80 roughly where as we have had great meals at Pubs around the area for half that price. Please do not waste your money on this place and instead go somewhere else!!!

hX65tJ8goJQcv8igbYK32A.text: Amazing place!! We have reserved tables for 20 people as all my daughter's friends were in London from Los Angeles  to celebrate  her wedding... we were so happy with this place!!! Food was espectacular but more than that the service was unbelievable!! LIDIA, thank you so much for your kindness, professionalism and great actitud! Your were wonderful. Highly recommended!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

NCyNThuugeZ70vMzE6WCag.text: Ever the BBQ lover, I equally love introducing other people to it, making suggestions and trying to impart the little bit of knowledge I have. Situated right next to the WW1 poppy display, close to the tube and a short walk from the brother's flat, Bodean's became the logical choice.Our only worry was the number in our party - 7 - and the potential wait. However, they were surprisingly accommodating and, after a 15/20 minute wait, we received our text alert to let us know our table was ready. Seated downstairs, the atmosphere was loud and exciting, and I couldn't wait to get stuck in to the menu. They have all the goodies here; wings, nachos, numerous ribs, hot dogs, burgers, chicken, pulled pork, and even the rarely-seen-in-the-UK burnt ends. We ordered a round of drinks and, after some conversation about what we could share and how many sides we could potentially eat between us, the food.There were plenty of different meals around the table, but I went for the tri-trip sandwich, which involved melt-y soft beef on a sesame bun, served with fries and coleslaw. The meat was delicious, but the bun fell apart very quickly (even when flipping upside down in the usual fashion) and the fries didn't blow me away. I tried to liven them up with some of the hot sauce, but again, it was slightly lacklustre. The sweet potato fries were a tastier side, and seemed to have a better crisp to them. The onion rings, although tasty, were slightly anemic - papa wasn't impressed, and he knows what he's talking about! The chicken wings with bourbon sauce were a lovely, sticky, saucey mess, though I was slightly taken a-back when we tried to order mild and were told that mild just meant plain.Everyone around the table was full and content, though I think it was perhaps missing a bit of the 'edge' we have become accustomed to, and service was slightly unfocused due to the masses of people. I'd try again - but perhaps a different branch? Oh, and I'd totally decorate my house in the Bodean's way. Golden pig head = win.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. sauces (2014)
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. pulled pork dinner (2014)
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. chilli cheese dog (2014)

M4E0lUYNg5Z7cHW1AqV4Ew.text: Absolutely loved the ambience, great customer service & food!  Will be going back for more! Recommend the bbq chicken & corn!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Nom mom!! The pork burnt ends the best! Came back 3xs!

lWKmoMvX-bTJnA-a7qRIcQ.text: Bodeans each and every time I've visited has been incredibly disappointing. It gets nearly everything right, then fails on the food each time. I will say now Bodean's totally delivered on this visit to the one close to the Tower of London.Staff were great. Constantly stopped by to ask how we were. Very friendly and relaxed.We ordered a sharing selection of meats and it was amazing. Meats were falling off the bone. Pulled pork was tender as silk, chicken just wow. Good helpings of coleslaw and chips completed an epic meal which we just about finished, but it was a good struggle particularly as I was wondering if we had enough when it first arrived. Bodean's sauces were epic. Some people don't like a lot of sauce on their meats. I'm of the opposite variety. I love bbq sauce and the hickory and chipotle sauce is much appreciated, especially when some other places actually charge for sauces by the thimble. Insulting to say the least. Keep it up guys.

q5ALkb1Zk-CUv_LfumKW1g.text: I'd heard a lot about Bodeans, so expectations were high when I finally got to try it out! We were hung over and hungry, and it was a very hot day! Thankfully they have ace air con, and we were soon cooled down and ready for food. I opted for the chicken, pulled pork and sausage combination to share with my other half, and a few sides (maximising my food options!). The food arrived fairly quickly, and looked amazing! The meat was ALL delicious, and was accompanied by some coleslaw and sweet potato fries (I paid extra to upgrade from regular). The chicken was my absolute favourite, it was so juicy and tasty, I was a bit gutted that I had to share! The sides were a bit of a let down... We ordered the poutine, and I was somewhat disappointed with the huge amounts of chewy melted cheese - a far cry from the traditional cheese curds. The poutine was also cold, so it was returned and replaced with a less cheesy and hotter portion, and was also taken off the bill which was a nice touch. We also opted for a side of mac and cheese. This came with a pleasant breadcrumb topping, and was surprisingly light! The sauce wasn't super thick and cheesy like most versions of the dish I've had, and I was a little disappointed - my hangover definitely wanted the heavier and more comforting kind!Next came dessert.  I went for the key lime pie and a coffee - a good combo deal at just £5. The pie topping was light and almost moussey, with a lovely sharp tang. It went down very easily!All in all not bad, but not as good as the hype - but not as good as the closer to home Reds.....

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Deliciously light and tangy key lime pie
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. The somewhat disappointing poutine... Cheese overload!
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Chicken, pulled pork and sausage combination

6DvLlYBGkzLaeODH0bquoQ.text: Had several great traditional barbecue meals here during my trip from the US. I want to say that the Service was awesome but the ribs and burnt ends are just as good as you'll find in a small town in Texas. Also, you can catch American football on at given times. Call and they can tell you what game will be playing. Shout out to all the bar staff and my new friend Bill who is a regular there. He'll be around the bar area with a happy smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Football schedule.

X2LZGbGWCD06ch9tsCeH4g.text: As a Bodean's virgin and the fact that I was invited to lunch without paying attention to where I was going I really didn't know what to expect.On arrival the restaurant appears to be a small converted bar similar to the one in the programme Cheers is the way I would describe it lol. You are also met by a friendly greeter. We were escorted downstairs to a much larger area decorated with red walls and gold pigs/cow heads. Funnily enough it works :).The menu is easy to read and the service very quick indeed. We ordered the Bodean's platter for 3 and the food arrived within 10 mins which is an added bonus when you are in a tight schedule. I have to say the taste of the BBQ was lovely and I throughly enjoyed the array of pulled pork, 2 different sets of ribs, chicken thighs , slaw and seasoned fries. The BBQ Mayo is a lovely touch too.I saw lots of plates flying around as the place was packed , my advice would be don't order the burger if you are hungry, it appeared quite small.All in all a definite recommendation if you have a meat craving. Top tip on game days there are special offers on food and beer!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Bodean's platter

e16Fn-n2HAgSM42qirlbkA.text: Once my staple for American food in London I am afraid this chain has steadily declined over the years with the prices going the other way.Where once I would visit almost weekly for a number of years I have decided to visit no more. Service slow and unfriendly, and the food (on my last visit) inedible.A real shame.
